title: How to Make a Log File

steps.headline: Add this code to the top line of the text file: "echo %date% %time% >>log.txt".
Click "Save As" from the file menu, and write your file name in the format shown below.
steps.description:
"Name.bat"
Note: You have to type all 10 characters of the above line
Later you may change the 4 characters of Name (4 characters before Dot)
The first and last 5 characters are to be written as it is

steps.headline: Save it in the folder where you want to see the log file.
steps.description: Note. Whenever you open Name.bat file( batch file) your log file (log.txt) will get updated. It will contain list of dates and times at which it was opened.

tyn: Windows operating system (The above works perfect with Window Vista, but ways to use Task Scheduler may change slightly with other versions of Windows (xp or 7).)
text:
Open Notepad.  Add this code to the top line of the text file: "echo %date% %time% >>log.txt".  Click "Save As" from the file menu, and write your file name in the format shown below. "Name.bat"
Note: You have to type all 10 characters of the above line
Later you may change the 4 characters of Name (4 characters before Dot)
The first and last 5 characters are to be written as it is Save it in the folder where you want to see the log file. Note. Whenever you open Name.bat file( batch file) your log file (log.txt) will get updated. It will contain list of dates and times at which it was opened.
sentences: Add this code to the top line of the text file: "echo %date% %time% >>log.txt".
Click "Save As" from the file menu, and write your file name in the format shown below.

"Name.bat"
Note: You have to type all 10 characters of the above line
Later you may change the 4 characters of Name (4 characters before Dot)
The first and last 5 characters are to be written as it is Save it in the folder where you want to see the log file.
Whenever you open Name.bat file( batch file) your log file (log.txt) will get updated.
It will contain list of dates and times at which it was opened.
